body.description: 50% cotton, 50% polyester (Oxford is 47% cotton; 53% polyester), slightly contoured for a flattering fit; clean-finished side vents, SpotShield stain-resistant treatment; welt-knit collar; side seamed, back neck tape for a clean, comfortable finish, tagless label; pearlized buttons with durable cross stitching, elongated four-button placket with bottom box stitch reinforcement, double-needle stitched bottom hem; 1x1 rib knit sleeve bands, Sizes: S-2XL.

productInformation.value: #727,896 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry) #610 in Women's Polo Shirts

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2015
reviews.reviewText: This just arrived. I'm on a diet and losing weight so it was hard for me to judge what size to order. Some of the reviews mentioned the sizes run small so I ordered one size up and it does fit. But one thing to be aware of is that this is a cotton/polyester blend, so it is a bit clingy. It's also a little bit see-through, unlike 100% cotton. But it's not too see-through. Otherwise, it's fine.Update: I ordered four shirts at the same time, and the other three just got delivered. The white one is fine, but the two pink and one blue shirt are very dull in color. The colors shown are not the colors you'll end up with. Both the pink shirts and the blue shirt look very grayish, as if they had been washed with something black that leaked color all over them, you know what I mean? I can't think of a better way to explain that.I'm sure the dark colors like the dark green and navy blue are fine. And I'm sure the gray is fine. But if you are looking to get pastels, you should look at different shirts. These will be a disappointment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Don’t Buy, poor quality!
reviews.reviewText: This shirt is defective, when wearing buttons are crooked and the seems on side are not even. Poor craftsmanship used in sewing this shirt together. Not to mention this shirt is completely see through. Don’t buy waste of money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Super large, see through and NOT sweat friendly.
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to love this cotton-blend polo with the slightly round collar to play golf in, but I do not.It’s a 50/50 cotton poly blend and feels like a basic pique cotton polo, only thinner; definitely not dri-fit, moisture wicking or anything of the sort. By the feel of the material, sweat will definitely sit and stay.I wear a 12/14 blazer and this top is huge. Loose across the chest (D), loose across the waist and hips. At 5’3”, the hemline falls just at or below my natural hip.Good value for the money if used as a layering piece under a jacket or cardigan, but not for athletic wear. Be sure to size down a full size for a loose fit and possibly two, for a fitted look.Will be returning.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The products are always great this is the second time I've orders these for work.

reviews.reviewText: Shorty was nice and fit perfectly

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2019
reviews.reviewText: Sizes are off. XXL was more lime a Lg. Also too much spandex tightness and material was thin....see thru. Returned both of these. Also had to pay return shipping of $10 and apparently resticking fee not noted on description/info on item. It appears I may get a refund for what 1 shirt cost! That makes me very unhappy!
